'The Colombian Horse' was conceived by the nariñense sculptor Álvaro Zarama Cabrera, the sculpture has three cylinders whose structure is made of iron, on the top of each of the three cylinders has been implanted a horse head built in plastic reinforced with polyester fiberglass; each of the bodies of the sculpture was applied based paint and synthetic paint in the colors of the flag of Colombia, for the purpose of constructing meaning and symbolic value of the horse for Colombians.

The artist thus interpret the spirit of Villamil recognized the important role played by the horse in the social and economic development of Colombians; the social aspects has been an integrating factor used by many generations and at various times as a vehicle to reach business appointments, wars, religious ceremonies, dating and of course the traditional national romance.
